page.title: 09WALLISDOWN DAY CENTRE
page.content: At the Day Centre three people volunteer to keep the Centre clean and to help the old people. Also they have a number of people making tea and coffee. A lady is in overall charge of the centre. There are about 90 elderly people who regularly attend the centre. They have an ambulance which is provided by the D.H.S.S. to collect them and to take them home. A hot meal is provided by the Residential Home which costs them 83p a day. There is a hairdressing service available, once a week, which they have to pay for, run by a lady who owns her own hairdressing shop. In their spare time they make trays, baskets, coathanger covers, pot plant holders, bed socks, hats, window cloths, blankets and rugs which they later sell to visitors.
